00045 static int local_nid_dist_zero = 1;
00046 module_param(local_nid_dist_zero, int, 0444);

00049 int
00050 lnet_fail_nid(lnet_nid_t nid, unsigned int threshold)
00051 {
00052         lnet_test_peer_t *tp;
00053         struct list_head *el;
00054         struct list_head *next;
00055         struct list_head  cull;
00056 
00057         /* NB: use lnet_net_lock(0) to serialize operations on test peers */
00058         if (threshold != 0) {
00059                 /* Adding a new entry */
00060                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(tp, sizeof(*tp));
00061                 if (tp == NULL)
00062                         return -ENOMEM;
00063 
00064                 tp->tp_nid = nid;
00065                 tp->tp_threshold = threshold;
00066 
00067                 lnet_net_lock(0);
00068                 list_add_tail(&tp->tp_list, &the_lnet.ln_test_peers);
00069                 lnet_net_unlock(0);
00070                 return 0;
00071         }
00072 
00073         /* removing entries */
00074         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cull);
00075 
00076         lnet_net_lock(0);
00077 
00078         list_for_each_safe(el, next, &the_lnet.ln_test_peers) {
00079                 tp = list_entry(el, lnet_test_peer_t, tp_list);
00080 
00081                 if (tp->tp_threshold == 0 ||    /* needs culling anyway */
00082                     nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||      /* removing all entries */
00083                     tp->tp_nid == nid) {        /* matched this one */
00084                         list_del(&tp->tp_list);
00085                         list_add(&tp->tp_list, &cull);
00086                 }
00087         }
00088 
00089         lnet_net_unlock(0);
00090 
00091         while (!list_empty(&cull)) {
00092                 tp = list_entry(cull.next, lnet_test_peer_t, tp_list);
00093 
00094                 list_del(&tp->tp_list);
00095                 LIBCFS_FREE(tp, sizeof(*tp));
00096         }
00097         return 0;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static int
00101 fail_peer (lnet_nid_t nid, int outgoing)
00102 {
00103         lnet_test_peer_t *tp;
00104         struct list_head *el;
00105         struct list_head *next;
00106         struct list_head  cull;
00107         int               fail = 0;
00108 
00109         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cull);
00110 
00111         /* NB: use lnet_net_lock(0) to serialize operations on test peers */
00112         lnet_net_lock(0);
00113 
00114         list_for_each_safe(el, next, &the_lnet.ln_test_peers) {
00115                 tp = list_entry(el, lnet_test_peer_t, tp_list);
00116 
00117                 if (tp->tp_threshold == 0) {
00118                         /* zombie entry */
00119                         if (outgoing) {
00120                                 /* only cull zombies on outgoing tests,
00121                                  * since we may be at interrupt priority on
00122                                  * incoming messages. */
00123                                 list_del(&tp->tp_list);
00124                                 list_add(&tp->tp_list, &cull);
00125                         }
00126                         continue;
00127                 }
00128 
00129                 if (tp->tp_nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||       /* fail every peer */
00130                     nid == tp->tp_nid) {                /* fail this peer */
00131                         fail = 1;
00132 
00133                         if (tp->tp_threshold != LNET_MD_THRESH_INF) {
00134                                 tp->tp_threshold--;
00135                                 if (outgoing &&
00136                                     tp->tp_threshold == 0) {
00137                                         /* see above */
00138                                         list_del(&tp->tp_list);
00139                                         list_add(&tp->tp_list, &cull);
00140                                 }
00141                         }
00142                         break;
00143                 }
00144         }
00145 
00146         lnet_net_unlock(0);
00147 
00148         while (!list_empty(&cull)) {
00149                 tp = list_entry(cull.next, lnet_test_peer_t, tp_list);
00150                 list_del(&tp->tp_list);
00151 
00152                 LIBCFS_FREE(tp, sizeof(*tp));
00153         }
00154 
00155         return fail;
00156 }

00158 unsigned int
00159 lnet_iov_nob(unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov)
00160 {
00161         unsigned int nob = 0;
00162 
00163         LASSERT(niov == 0 || iov != NULL);
00164         while (niov-- > 0)
00165                 nob += (iov++)->iov_len;
00166 
00167         return (nob);
00168 }
00169 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_iov_nob);
00170 
00171 void
00172 lnet_copy_iov2iov(unsigned int ndiov, struct kvec *diov, unsigned int doffset,
00173                   unsigned int nsiov, struct kvec *siov, unsigned int soffset,
00174                   unsigned int nob)
00175 {
00176         /* NB diov, siov are READ-ONLY */
00177         unsigned int  this_nob;
00178 
00179         if (nob == 0)
00180                 return;
00181 
00182         /* skip complete frags before 'doffset' */
00183         LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00184         while (doffset >= diov->iov_len) {
00185                 doffset -= diov->iov_len;
00186                 diov++;
00187                 ndiov--;
00188                 LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00189         }
00190 
00191         /* skip complete frags before 'soffset' */
00192         LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00193         while (soffset >= siov->iov_len) {
00194                 soffset -= siov->iov_len;
00195                 siov++;
00196                 nsiov--;
00197                 LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00198         }
00199 
00200         do {
00201                 LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00202                 LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00203                 this_nob = MIN(diov->iov_len - doffset,
00204                                siov->iov_len - soffset);
00205                 this_nob = MIN(this_nob, nob);
00206 
00207                 memcpy ((char *)diov->iov_base + doffset,
00208                         (char *)siov->iov_base + soffset, this_nob);
00209                 nob -= this_nob;
00210 
00211                 if (diov->iov_len > doffset + this_nob) {
00212                         doffset += this_nob;
00213                 } else {
00214                         diov++;
00215                         ndiov--;
00216                         doffset = 0;
00217                 }
00218 
00219                 if (siov->iov_len > soffset + this_nob) {
00220                         soffset += this_nob;
00221                 } else {
00222                         siov++;
00223                         nsiov--;
00224                         soffset = 0;
00225                 }
00226         } while (nob > 0);
00227 }
00228 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_copy_iov2iov);
00229 
00230 int
00231 lnet_extract_iov(int dst_niov, struct kvec *dst,
00232                  int src_niov, struct kvec *src,
00233                  unsigned int offset, unsigned int len)
00234 {
00235         /* Initialise 'dst' to the subset of 'src' starting at 'offset',
00236          * for exactly 'len' bytes, and return the number of entries.
00237          * NB not destructive to 'src' */
00238         unsigned int    frag_len;
00239         unsigned int    niov;
00240 
00241         if (len == 0)                           /* no data => */
00242                 return (0);                     /* no frags */
00243 
00244         LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00245         while (offset >= src->iov_len) {      /* skip initial frags */
00246                 offset -= src->iov_len;
00247                 src_niov--;
00248                 src++;
00249                 LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00250         }
00251 
00252         niov = 1;
00253         for (;;) {
00254                 LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00255                 LASSERT ((int)niov <= dst_niov);
00256 
00257                 frag_len = src->iov_len - offset;
00258                 dst->iov_base = ((char *)src->iov_base) + offset;
00259 
00260                 if (len <= frag_len) {
00261                         dst->iov_len = len;
00262                         return (niov);
00263                 }
00264 
00265                 dst->iov_len = frag_len;
00266 
00267                 len -= frag_len;
00268                 dst++;
00269                 src++;
00270                 niov++;
00271                 src_niov--;
00272                 offset = 0;
00273         }
00274 }
00275 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_extract_iov);

00278 unsigned int
00279 lnet_kiov_nob(unsigned int niov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov)
00280 {
00281         unsigned int  nob = 0;
00282 
00283         LASSERT(niov == 0 || kiov != NULL);
00284         while (niov-- > 0)
00285                 nob += (kiov++)->kiov_len;
00286 
00287         return (nob);
00288 }
00289 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_kiov_nob);
00290 
00291 void
00292 lnet_copy_kiov2kiov(unsigned int ndiov, lnet_kiov_t *diov, unsigned int doffset,
00293                     unsigned int nsiov, lnet_kiov_t *siov, unsigned int soffset,
00294                     unsigned int nob)
00295 {
00296         /* NB diov, siov are READ-ONLY */
00297         unsigned int    this_nob;
00298         char           *daddr = NULL;
00299         char           *saddr = NULL;
00300 
00301         if (nob == 0)
00302                 return;
00303 
00304         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00305 
00306         LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00307         while (doffset >= diov->kiov_len) {
00308                 doffset -= diov->kiov_len;
00309                 diov++;
00310                 ndiov--;
00311                 LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00312         }
00313 
00314         LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00315         while (soffset >= siov->kiov_len) {
00316                 soffset -= siov->kiov_len;
00317                 siov++;
00318                 nsiov--;
00319                 LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00320         }
00321 
00322         do {
00323                 LASSERT (ndiov > 0);
00324                 LASSERT (nsiov > 0);
00325                 this_nob = MIN(diov->kiov_len - doffset,
00326                                siov->kiov_len - soffset);
00327                 this_nob = MIN(this_nob, nob);
00328 
00329                 if (daddr == NULL)
00330                         daddr = ((char *)kmap(diov->kiov_page)) +
00331                                 diov->kiov_offset + doffset;
00332                 if (saddr == NULL)
00333                         saddr = ((char *)kmap(siov->kiov_page)) +
00334                                 siov->kiov_offset + soffset;
00335 
00336                 /* Vanishing risk of kmap deadlock when mapping 2 pages.
00337                  * However in practice at least one of the kiovs will be mapped
00338                  * kernel pages and the map/unmap will be NOOPs */
00339 
00340                 memcpy (daddr, saddr, this_nob);
00341                 nob -= this_nob;
00342 
00343                 if (diov->kiov_len > doffset + this_nob) {
00344                         daddr += this_nob;
00345                         doffset += this_nob;
00346                 } else {
00347                         kunmap(diov->kiov_page);
00348                         daddr = NULL;
00349                         diov++;
00350                         ndiov--;
00351                         doffset = 0;
00352                 }
00353 
00354                 if (siov->kiov_len > soffset + this_nob) {
00355                         saddr += this_nob;
00356                         soffset += this_nob;
00357                 } else {
00358                         kunmap(siov->kiov_page);
00359                         saddr = NULL;
00360                         siov++;
00361                         nsiov--;
00362                         soffset = 0;
00363                 }
00364         } while (nob > 0);
00365 
00366         if (daddr != NULL)
00367                 kunmap(diov->kiov_page);
00368         if (saddr != NULL)
00369                 kunmap(siov->kiov_page);
00370 }
00371 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_copy_kiov2kiov);
00372 
00373 void
00374 lnet_copy_kiov2iov (unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov, unsigned int iovoffset,
00375                     unsigned int nkiov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov, unsigned int kiovoffset,
00376                     unsigned int nob)
00377 {
00378         /* NB iov, kiov are READ-ONLY */
00379         unsigned int    this_nob;
00380         char           *addr = NULL;
00381 
00382         if (nob == 0)
00383                 return;
00384 
00385         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00386 
00387         LASSERT (niov > 0);
00388         while (iovoffset >= iov->iov_len) {
00389                 iovoffset -= iov->iov_len;
00390                 iov++;
00391                 niov--;
00392                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00393         }
00394 
00395         LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00396         while (kiovoffset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00397                 kiovoffset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00398                 kiov++;
00399                 nkiov--;
00400                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00401         }
00402 
00403         do {
00404                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00405                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00406                 this_nob = MIN(iov->iov_len - iovoffset,
00407                                kiov->kiov_len - kiovoffset);
00408                 this_nob = MIN(this_nob, nob);
00409 
00410                 if (addr == NULL)
00411                         addr = ((char *)kmap(kiov->kiov_page)) +
00412                                 kiov->kiov_offset + kiovoffset;
00413 
00414                 memcpy ((char *)iov->iov_base + iovoffset, addr, this_nob);
00415                 nob -= this_nob;
00416 
00417                 if (iov->iov_len > iovoffset + this_nob) {
00418                         iovoffset += this_nob;
00419                 } else {
00420                         iov++;
00421                         niov--;
00422                         iovoffset = 0;
00423                 }
00424 
00425                 if (kiov->kiov_len > kiovoffset + this_nob) {
00426                         addr += this_nob;
00427                         kiovoffset += this_nob;
00428                 } else {
00429                         kunmap(kiov->kiov_page);
00430                         addr = NULL;
00431                         kiov++;
00432                         nkiov--;
00433                         kiovoffset = 0;
00434                 }
00435 
00436         } while (nob > 0);
00437 
00438         if (addr != NULL)
00439                 kunmap(kiov->kiov_page);
00440 }
00441 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_copy_kiov2iov);
00442 
00443 void
00444 lnet_copy_iov2kiov(unsigned int nkiov, lnet_kiov_t *kiov, unsigned int kiovoffset,
00445                    unsigned int niov, struct kvec *iov, unsigned int iovoffset,
00446                    unsigned int nob)
00447 {
00448         /* NB kiov, iov are READ-ONLY */
00449         unsigned int    this_nob;
00450         char           *addr = NULL;
00451 
00452         if (nob == 0)
00453                 return;
00454 
00455         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00456 
00457         LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00458         while (kiovoffset >= kiov->kiov_len) {
00459                 kiovoffset -= kiov->kiov_len;
00460                 kiov++;
00461                 nkiov--;
00462                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00463         }
00464 
00465         LASSERT (niov > 0);
00466         while (iovoffset >= iov->iov_len) {
00467                 iovoffset -= iov->iov_len;
00468                 iov++;
00469                 niov--;
00470                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00471         }
00472 
00473         do {
00474                 LASSERT (nkiov > 0);
00475                 LASSERT (niov > 0);
00476                 this_nob = MIN(kiov->kiov_len - kiovoffset,
00477                                iov->iov_len - iovoffset);
00478                 this_nob = MIN(this_nob, nob);
00479 
00480                 if (addr == NULL)
00481                         addr = ((char *)kmap(kiov->kiov_page)) +
00482                                 kiov->kiov_offset + kiovoffset;
00483 
00484                 memcpy (addr, (char *)iov->iov_base + iovoffset, this_nob);
00485                 nob -= this_nob;
00486 
00487                 if (kiov->kiov_len > kiovoffset + this_nob) {
00488                         addr += this_nob;
00489                         kiovoffset += this_nob;
00490                 } else {
00491                         kunmap(kiov->kiov_page);
00492                         addr = NULL;
00493                         kiov++;
00494                         nkiov--;
00495                         kiovoffset = 0;
00496                 }
00497 
00498                 if (iov->iov_len > iovoffset + this_nob) {
00499                         iovoffset += this_nob;
00500                 } else {
00501                         iov++;
00502                         niov--;
00503                         iovoffset = 0;
00504                 }
00505         } while (nob > 0);
00506 
00507         if (addr != NULL)
00508                 kunmap(kiov->kiov_page);
00509 }
00510 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_copy_iov2kiov);
00511 
00512 int
00513 lnet_extract_kiov(int dst_niov, lnet_kiov_t *dst,
00514                   int src_niov, lnet_kiov_t *src,
00515                   unsigned int offset, unsigned int len)
00516 {
00517         /* Initialise 'dst' to the subset of 'src' starting at 'offset',
00518          * for exactly 'len' bytes, and return the number of entries.
00519          * NB not destructive to 'src' */
00520         unsigned int    frag_len;
00521         unsigned int    niov;
00522 
00523         if (len == 0)                           /* no data => */
00524                 return (0);                     /* no frags */
00525 
00526         LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00527         while (offset >= src->kiov_len) {      /* skip initial frags */
00528                 offset -= src->kiov_len;
00529                 src_niov--;
00530                 src++;
00531                 LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00532         }
00533 
00534         niov = 1;
00535         for (;;) {
00536                 LASSERT (src_niov > 0);
00537                 LASSERT ((int)niov <= dst_niov);
00538 
00539                 frag_len = src->kiov_len - offset;
00540                 dst->kiov_page = src->kiov_page;
00541                 dst->kiov_offset = src->kiov_offset + offset;
00542 
00543                 if (len <= frag_len) {
00544                         dst->kiov_len = len;
00545                         LASSERT (dst->kiov_offset + dst->kiov_len <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00546                         return niov;
00547                 }
00548 
00549                 dst->kiov_len = frag_len;
00550                 LASSERT (dst->kiov_offset + dst->kiov_len <= PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
00551 
00552                 len -= frag_len;
00553                 dst++;
00554                 src++;
00555                 niov++;
00556                 src_niov--;
00557                 offset = 0;
00558         }
00559 }
00560 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_extract_kiov);
00561 
00562 void
00563 lnet_ni_recv(lnet_ni_t *ni, void *private, lnet_msg_t *msg, int delayed,
00564              unsigned int offset, unsigned int mlen, unsigned int rlen)
00565 {
00566         unsigned int  niov = 0;
00567         struct kvec *iov = NULL;
00568         lnet_kiov_t  *kiov = NULL;
00569         int           rc;
00570 
00571         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00572         LASSERT (mlen == 0 || msg != NULL);
00573 
00574         if (msg != NULL) {
00575                 LASSERT(msg->msg_receiving);
00576                 LASSERT(!msg->msg_sending);
00577                 LASSERT(rlen == msg->msg_len);
00578                 LASSERT(mlen <= msg->msg_len);
00579                 LASSERT(msg->msg_offset == offset);
00580                 LASSERT(msg->msg_wanted == mlen);
00581 
00582                 msg->msg_receiving = 0;
00583 
00584                 if (mlen != 0) {
00585                         niov = msg->msg_niov;
00586                         iov  = msg->msg_iov;
00587                         kiov = msg->msg_kiov;
00588 
00589                         LASSERT (niov > 0);
00590                         LASSERT ((iov == NULL) != (kiov == NULL));
00591                 }
00592         }
00593 
00594         rc = (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_recv)(ni, private, msg, delayed,
00595                                     niov, iov, kiov, offset, mlen, rlen);
00596         if (rc < 0)
00597                 lnet_finalize(ni, msg, rc);
00598 }
00599 
00600 static void
00601 lnet_setpayloadbuffer(lnet_msg_t *msg)
00602 {
00603         lnet_libmd_t *md = msg->msg_md;
00604 
00605         LASSERT (msg->msg_len > 0);
00606         LASSERT (!msg->msg_routing);
00607         LASSERT (md != NULL);
00608         LASSERT (msg->msg_niov == 0);
00609         LASSERT (msg->msg_iov == NULL);
00610         LASSERT (msg->msg_kiov == NULL);
00611 
00612         msg->msg_niov = md->md_niov;
00613         if ((md->md_options & LNET_MD_KIOV) != 0)
00614                 msg->msg_kiov = md->md_iov.kiov;
00615         else
00616                 msg->msg_iov = md->md_iov.iov;
00617 }
00618 
00619 void
00620 lnet_prep_send(lnet_msg_t *msg, int type, lnet_process_id_t target,
00621                unsigned int offset, unsigned int len)
00622 {
00623         msg->msg_type = type;
00624         msg->msg_target = target;
00625         msg->msg_len = len;
00626         msg->msg_offset = offset;
00627 
00628         if (len != 0)
00629                 lnet_setpayloadbuffer(msg);
00630 
00631         memset (&msg->msg_hdr, 0, sizeof (msg->msg_hdr));
00632         msg->msg_hdr.type           = cpu_to_le32(type);
00633         msg->msg_hdr.dest_nid       = cpu_to_le64(target.nid);
00634         msg->msg_hdr.dest_pid       = cpu_to_le32(target.pid);
00635         /* src_nid will be set later */
00636         msg->msg_hdr.src_pid        = cpu_to_le32(the_lnet.ln_pid);
00637         msg->msg_hdr.payload_length = cpu_to_le32(len);
00638 }
00639 
00640 static void
00641 lnet_ni_send(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
00642 {
00643         void   *priv = msg->msg_private;
00644         int     rc;
00645 
00646         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
00647         LASSERT (LNET_NETTYP(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid)) == LOLND ||
00648                  (msg->msg_txcredit && msg->msg_peertxcredit));
00649 
00650         rc = (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_send)(ni, priv, msg);
00651         if (rc < 0)
00652                 lnet_finalize(ni, msg, rc);
00653 }
00654 
00655 static int
00656 lnet_ni_eager_recv(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
00657 {
00658         int     rc;
00659 
00660         LASSERT(!msg->msg_sending);
00661         LASSERT(msg->msg_receiving);
00662         LASSERT(!msg->msg_rx_ready_delay);
00663         LASSERT(ni->ni_lnd->lnd_eager_recv != NULL);
00664 
00665         msg->msg_rx_ready_delay = 1;
00666         rc = (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_eager_recv)(ni, msg->msg_private, msg,
00667                                           &msg->msg_private);
00668         if (rc != 0) {
00669                 CERROR("recv from %s / send to %s aborted: "
00670                        "eager_recv failed %d\n",
00671                        libcfs_nid2str(msg->msg_rxpeer->lp_nid),
00672                        libcfs_id2str(msg->msg_target), rc);
00673                 LASSERT(rc < 0); /* required by my callers */
00674         }
00675 
00676         return rc;
00677 }
00678 
00679 /* NB: caller shall hold a ref on 'lp' as I'd drop lnet_net_lock */
00680 static void
00681 lnet_ni_query_locked(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_peer_t *lp)
00682 {
00683         cfs_time_t last_alive = 0;
00684 
00685         LASSERT(lnet_peer_aliveness_enabled(lp));
00686         LASSERT(ni->ni_lnd->lnd_query != NULL);
00687 
00688         lnet_net_unlock(lp->lp_cpt);
00689         (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_query)(ni, lp->lp_nid, &last_alive);
00690         lnet_net_lock(lp->lp_cpt);
00691 
00692         lp->lp_last_query = cfs_time_current();
00693 
00694         if (last_alive != 0) /* NI has updated timestamp */
00695                 lp->lp_last_alive = last_alive;
00696 }
00697 
00698 /* NB: always called with lnet_net_lock held */
00699 static inline int
00700 lnet_peer_is_alive (lnet_peer_t *lp, cfs_time_t now)
00701 {
00702         int        alive;
00703         cfs_time_t deadline;
00704 
00705         LASSERT (lnet_peer_aliveness_enabled(lp));
00706 
00707         /* Trust lnet_notify() if it has more recent aliveness news, but
00708          * ignore the initial assumed death (see lnet_peers_start_down()).
00709          */
00710         if (!lp->lp_alive && lp->lp_alive_count > 0 &&
00711             cfs_time_aftereq(lp->lp_timestamp, lp->lp_last_alive))
00712                 return 0;
00713 
00714         deadline = cfs_time_add(lp->lp_last_alive,
00715                                 cfs_time_seconds(lp->lp_ni->ni_peertimeout));
00716         alive = cfs_time_after(deadline, now);
00717 
00718         /* Update obsolete lp_alive except for routers assumed to be dead
00719          * initially, because router checker would update aliveness in this
00720          * case, and moreover lp_last_alive at peer creation is assumed.
00721          */
00722         if (alive && !lp->lp_alive &&
00723             !(lnet_isrouter(lp) && lp->lp_alive_count == 0))
00724                 lnet_notify_locked(lp, 0, 1, lp->lp_last_alive);
00725 
00726         return alive;
00727 }
00728 
00729 
00730 /* NB: returns 1 when alive, 0 when dead, negative when error;
00731  *     may drop the lnet_net_lock */
00732 static int
00733 lnet_peer_alive_locked (lnet_peer_t *lp)
00734 {
00735         cfs_time_t now = cfs_time_current();
00736 
00737         if (!lnet_peer_aliveness_enabled(lp))
00738                 return -ENODEV;
00739 
00740         if (lnet_peer_is_alive(lp, now))
00741                 return 1;
00742 
00743         /* Peer appears dead, but we should avoid frequent NI queries (at
00744          * most once per lnet_queryinterval seconds). */
00745         if (lp->lp_last_query != 0) {
00746                 static const int lnet_queryinterval = 1;
00747 
00748                 cfs_time_t next_query =
00749                            cfs_time_add(lp->lp_last_query,
00750                                         cfs_time_seconds(lnet_queryinterval));
00751 
00752                 if (cfs_time_before(now, next_query)) {
00753                         if (lp->lp_alive)
00754                                 CWARN("Unexpected aliveness of peer %s: "
00755                                       "%d < %d (%d/%d)\n",
00756                                       libcfs_nid2str(lp->lp_nid),
00757                                       (int)now, (int)next_query,
00758                                       lnet_queryinterval,
00759                                       lp->lp_ni->ni_peertimeout);
00760                         return 0;
00761                 }
00762         }
00763 
00764         /* query NI for latest aliveness news */
00765         lnet_ni_query_locked(lp->lp_ni, lp);
00766 
00767         if (lnet_peer_is_alive(lp, now))
00768                 return 1;
00769 
00770         lnet_notify_locked(lp, 0, 0, lp->lp_last_alive);
00771         return 0;
00772 }
00773 
00785 static int
00786 lnet_post_send_locked(lnet_msg_t *msg, int do_send)
00787 {
00788         lnet_peer_t             *lp = msg->msg_txpeer;
00789         lnet_ni_t               *ni = lp->lp_ni;
00790         int                     cpt = msg->msg_tx_cpt;
00791         struct lnet_tx_queue    *tq = ni->ni_tx_queues[cpt];
00792 
00793         /* non-lnet_send() callers have checked before */
00794         LASSERT(!do_send || msg->msg_tx_delayed);
00795         LASSERT(!msg->msg_receiving);
00796         LASSERT(msg->msg_tx_committed);
00797 
00798         /* NB 'lp' is always the next hop */
00799         if ((msg->msg_target.pid & LNET_PID_USERFLAG) == 0 &&
00800             lnet_peer_alive_locked(lp) == 0) {
00801                 the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt]->drop_count++;
00802                 the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt]->drop_length += msg->msg_len;
00803                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00804 
00805                 CNETERR("Dropping message for %s: peer not alive\n",
00806                         libcfs_id2str(msg->msg_target));
00807                 if (do_send)
00808                         lnet_finalize(ni, msg, -EHOSTUNREACH);
00809 
00810                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00811                 return -EHOSTUNREACH;
00812         }
00813 
00814         if (msg->msg_md != NULL &&
00815             (msg->msg_md->md_flags & LNET_MD_FLAG_ABORTED) != 0) {
00816                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00817 
00818                 CNETERR("Aborting message for %s: LNetM[DE]Unlink() already "
00819                         "called on the MD/ME.\n",
00820                         libcfs_id2str(msg->msg_target));
00821                 if (do_send)
00822                         lnet_finalize(ni, msg, -ECANCELED);
00823 
00824                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00825                 return -ECANCELED;
00826         }
00827 
00828         if (!msg->msg_peertxcredit) {
00829                 LASSERT((lp->lp_txcredits < 0) ==
00830                         !list_empty(&lp->lp_txq));
00831 
00832                 msg->msg_peertxcredit = 1;
00833                 lp->lp_txqnob += msg->msg_len + sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
00834                 lp->lp_txcredits--;
00835 
00836                 if (lp->lp_txcredits < lp->lp_mintxcredits)
00837                         lp->lp_mintxcredits = lp->lp_txcredits;
00838 
00839                 if (lp->lp_txcredits < 0) {
00840                         msg->msg_tx_delayed = 1;
00841                         list_add_tail(&msg->msg_list, &lp->lp_txq);
00842                         return LNET_CREDIT_WAIT;
00843                 }
00844         }
00845 
00846         if (!msg->msg_txcredit) {
00847                 LASSERT((tq->tq_credits < 0) ==
00848                         !list_empty(&tq->tq_delayed));
00849 
00850                 msg->msg_txcredit = 1;
00851                 tq->tq_credits--;
00852 
00853                 if (tq->tq_credits < tq->tq_credits_min)
00854                         tq->tq_credits_min = tq->tq_credits;
00855 
00856                 if (tq->tq_credits < 0) {
00857                         msg->msg_tx_delayed = 1;
00858                         list_add_tail(&msg->msg_list, &tq->tq_delayed);
00859                         return LNET_CREDIT_WAIT;
00860                 }
00861         }
00862 
00863         if (do_send) {
00864                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00865                 lnet_ni_send(ni, msg);
00866                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00867         }
00868         return LNET_CREDIT_OK;
00869 }
00870 
00871 
00872 static lnet_rtrbufpool_t *
00873 lnet_msg2bufpool(lnet_msg_t *msg)
00874 {
00875         lnet_rtrbufpool_t       *rbp;
00876         int                     cpt;
00877 
00878         LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_committed);
00879 
00880         cpt = msg->msg_rx_cpt;
00881         rbp = &the_lnet.ln_rtrpools[cpt][0];
00882 
00883         LASSERT(msg->msg_len <= LNET_MTU);
00884         while (msg->msg_len > (unsigned int)rbp->rbp_npages * PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00885                 rbp++;
00886                 LASSERT(rbp < &the_lnet.ln_rtrpools[cpt][LNET_NRBPOOLS]);
00887         }
00888 
00889         return rbp;
00890 }
00891 
00892 static int
00893 lnet_post_routed_recv_locked (lnet_msg_t *msg, int do_recv)
00894 {
00895         /* lnet_parse is going to lnet_net_unlock immediately after this, so it
00896          * sets do_recv FALSE and I don't do the unlock/send/lock bit.
00897          * I return LNET_CREDIT_WAIT if msg blocked and LNET_CREDIT_OK if
00898          * received or OK to receive */
00899         lnet_peer_t         *lp = msg->msg_rxpeer;
00900         lnet_rtrbufpool_t   *rbp;
00901         lnet_rtrbuf_t       *rb;
00902 
00903         LASSERT (msg->msg_iov == NULL);
00904         LASSERT (msg->msg_kiov == NULL);
00905         LASSERT (msg->msg_niov == 0);
00906         LASSERT (msg->msg_routing);
00907         LASSERT (msg->msg_receiving);
00908         LASSERT (!msg->msg_sending);
00909 
00910         /* non-lnet_parse callers only receive delayed messages */
00911         LASSERT(!do_recv || msg->msg_rx_delayed);
00912 
00913         if (!msg->msg_peerrtrcredit) {
00914                 LASSERT((lp->lp_rtrcredits < 0) ==
00915                         !list_empty(&lp->lp_rtrq));
00916 
00917                 msg->msg_peerrtrcredit = 1;
00918                 lp->lp_rtrcredits--;
00919                 if (lp->lp_rtrcredits < lp->lp_minrtrcredits)
00920                         lp->lp_minrtrcredits = lp->lp_rtrcredits;
00921 
00922                 if (lp->lp_rtrcredits < 0) {
00923                         /* must have checked eager_recv before here */
00924                         LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_ready_delay);
00925                         msg->msg_rx_delayed = 1;
00926                         list_add_tail(&msg->msg_list, &lp->lp_rtrq);
00927                         return LNET_CREDIT_WAIT;
00928                 }
00929         }
00930 
00931         rbp = lnet_msg2bufpool(msg);
00932 
00933         if (!msg->msg_rtrcredit) {
00934                 msg->msg_rtrcredit = 1;
00935                 rbp->rbp_credits--;
00936                 if (rbp->rbp_credits < rbp->rbp_mincredits)
00937                         rbp->rbp_mincredits = rbp->rbp_credits;
00938 
00939                 if (rbp->rbp_credits < 0) {
00940                         /* must have checked eager_recv before here */
00941                         LASSERT(msg->msg_rx_ready_delay);
00942                         msg->msg_rx_delayed = 1;
00943                         list_add_tail(&msg->msg_list, &rbp->rbp_msgs);
00944                         return LNET_CREDIT_WAIT;
00945                 }
00946         }
00947 
00948         LASSERT(!list_empty(&rbp->rbp_bufs));
00949         rb = list_entry(rbp->rbp_bufs.next, lnet_rtrbuf_t, rb_list);
00950         list_del(&rb->rb_list);
00951 
00952         msg->msg_niov = rbp->rbp_npages;
00953         msg->msg_kiov = &rb->rb_kiov[0];
00954 
00955         if (do_recv) {
00956                 int cpt = msg->msg_rx_cpt;
00957 
00958                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
00959                 lnet_ni_recv(lp->lp_ni, msg->msg_private, msg, 1,
00960                              0, msg->msg_len, msg->msg_len);
00961                 lnet_net_lock(cpt);
00962         }
00963         return LNET_CREDIT_OK;
00964 }
00965 
00966 void
00967 lnet_return_tx_credits_locked(lnet_msg_t *msg)
00968 {
00969         lnet_peer_t     *txpeer = msg->msg_txpeer;
00970         lnet_msg_t      *msg2;
00971 
00972         if (msg->msg_txcredit) {
00973                 struct lnet_ni       *ni = txpeer->lp_ni;
00974                 struct lnet_tx_queue *tq = ni->ni_tx_queues[msg->msg_tx_cpt];
00975 
00976                 /* give back NI txcredits */
00977                 msg->msg_txcredit = 0;
00978 
00979                 LASSERT((tq->tq_credits < 0) ==
00980                         !list_empty(&tq->tq_delayed));
00981 
00982                 tq->tq_credits++;
00983                 if (tq->tq_credits <= 0) {
00984                         msg2 = list_entry(tq->tq_delayed.next,
00985                                           lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
00986                         list_del(&msg2->msg_list);
00987 
00988                         LASSERT(msg2->msg_txpeer->lp_ni == ni);
00989                         LASSERT(msg2->msg_tx_delayed);
00990 
00991                         (void) lnet_post_send_locked(msg2, 1);
00992                 }
00993         }
00994 
00995         if (msg->msg_peertxcredit) {
00996                 /* give back peer txcredits */
00997                 msg->msg_peertxcredit = 0;
00998 
00999                 LASSERT((txpeer->lp_txcredits < 0) ==
01000                         !list_empty(&txpeer->lp_txq));
01001 
01002                 txpeer->lp_txqnob -= msg->msg_len + sizeof(lnet_hdr_t);
01003                 LASSERT (txpeer->lp_txqnob >= 0);
01004 
01005                 txpeer->lp_txcredits++;
01006                 if (txpeer->lp_txcredits <= 0) {
01007                         msg2 = list_entry(txpeer->lp_txq.next,
01008                                               lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
01009                         list_del(&msg2->msg_list);
01010 
01011                         LASSERT(msg2->msg_txpeer == txpeer);
01012                         LASSERT(msg2->msg_tx_delayed);
01013 
01014                         (void) lnet_post_send_locked(msg2, 1);
01015                 }
01016         }
01017 
01018         if (txpeer != NULL) {
01019                 msg->msg_txpeer = NULL;
01020                 lnet_peer_decref_locked(txpeer);
01021         }
01022 }
01023 
01024 void
01025 lnet_schedule_blocked_locked(lnet_rtrbufpool_t *rbp)
01026 {
01027         lnet_msg_t      *msg;
01028 
01029         if (list_empty(&rbp->rbp_msgs))
01030                 return;
01031         msg = list_entry(rbp->rbp_msgs.next,
01032                          lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
01033         list_del(&msg->msg_list);
01034 
01035         (void)lnet_post_routed_recv_locked(msg, 1);
01036 }
01037 
01038 void
01039 lnet_drop_routed_msgs_locked(struct list_head *list, int cpt)
01040 {
01041         lnet_msg_t       *msg;
01042         lnet_msg_t       *tmp;
01043         struct list_head drop;
01044 
01045         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&drop);
01046 
01047         list_splice_init(list, &drop);
01048 
01049         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01050 
01051         list_for_each_entry_safe(msg, tmp, &drop, msg_list) {
01052                 lnet_ni_recv(msg->msg_rxpeer->lp_ni, msg->msg_private, NULL,
01053                              0, 0, 0, msg->msg_hdr.payload_length);
01054                 list_del_init(&msg->msg_list);
01055                 lnet_finalize(NULL, msg, -ECANCELED);
01056         }
01057 
01058         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
01059 }
01060 
01061 void
01062 lnet_return_rx_credits_locked(lnet_msg_t *msg)
01063 {
01064         lnet_peer_t     *rxpeer = msg->msg_rxpeer;
01065         lnet_msg_t      *msg2;
01066 
01067         if (msg->msg_rtrcredit) {
01068                 /* give back global router credits */
01069                 lnet_rtrbuf_t     *rb;
01070                 lnet_rtrbufpool_t *rbp;
01071 
01072                 /* NB If a msg ever blocks for a buffer in rbp_msgs, it stays
01073                  * there until it gets one allocated, or aborts the wait
01074                  * itself */
01075                 LASSERT(msg->msg_kiov != NULL);
01076 
01077                 rb = list_entry(msg->msg_kiov, lnet_rtrbuf_t, rb_kiov[0]);
01078                 rbp = rb->rb_pool;
01079 
01080                 msg->msg_kiov = NULL;
01081                 msg->msg_rtrcredit = 0;
01082 
01083                 LASSERT(rbp == lnet_msg2bufpool(msg));
01084 
01085                 LASSERT((rbp->rbp_credits > 0) ==
01086                         !list_empty(&rbp->rbp_bufs));
01087 
01088                 /* If routing is now turned off, we just drop this buffer and
01089                  * don't bother trying to return credits.  */
01090                 if (!the_lnet.ln_routing) {
01091                         lnet_destroy_rtrbuf(rb, rbp->rbp_npages);
01092                         goto routing_off;
01093                 }
01094 
01095                 /* It is possible that a user has lowered the desired number of
01096                  * buffers in this pool.  Make sure we never put back
01097                  * more buffers than the stated number. */
01098                 if (unlikely(rbp->rbp_credits >= rbp->rbp_req_nbuffers)) {
01099                         /* Discard this buffer so we don't have too
01100                          * many. */
01101                         lnet_destroy_rtrbuf(rb, rbp->rbp_npages);
01102                         rbp->rbp_nbuffers--;
01103                 } else {
01104                         list_add(&rb->rb_list, &rbp->rbp_bufs);
01105                         rbp->rbp_credits++;
01106                         if (rbp->rbp_credits <= 0)
01107                                 lnet_schedule_blocked_locked(rbp);
01108                 }
01109         }
01110 
01111 routing_off:
01112         if (msg->msg_peerrtrcredit) {
01113                 /* give back peer router credits */
01114                 msg->msg_peerrtrcredit = 0;
01115 
01116                 LASSERT((rxpeer->lp_rtrcredits < 0) ==
01117                         !list_empty(&rxpeer->lp_rtrq));
01118 
01119                 rxpeer->lp_rtrcredits++;
01120 
01121                 /* drop all messages which are queued to be routed on that
01122                  * peer. */
01123                 if (!the_lnet.ln_routing) {
01124                         lnet_drop_routed_msgs_locked(&rxpeer->lp_rtrq,
01125                                                      msg->msg_rx_cpt);
01126                 } else if (rxpeer->lp_rtrcredits <= 0) {
01127                         msg2 = list_entry(rxpeer->lp_rtrq.next,
01128                                           lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
01129                         list_del(&msg2->msg_list);
01130 
01131                         (void) lnet_post_routed_recv_locked(msg2, 1);
01132                 }
01133         }
01134         if (rxpeer != NULL) {
01135                 msg->msg_rxpeer = NULL;
01136                 lnet_peer_decref_locked(rxpeer);
01137         }
01138 }
01139 
01140 static int
01141 lnet_compare_routes(lnet_route_t *r1, lnet_route_t *r2)
01142 {
01143         lnet_peer_t *p1 = r1->lr_gateway;
01144         lnet_peer_t *p2 = r2->lr_gateway;
01145         int r1_hops = (r1->lr_hops == LNET_UNDEFINED_HOPS) ? 1 : r1->lr_hops;
01146         int r2_hops = (r2->lr_hops == LNET_UNDEFINED_HOPS) ? 1 : r2->lr_hops;
01147 
01148         if (r1->lr_priority < r2->lr_priority)
01149                 return 1;
01150 
01151         if (r1->lr_priority > r2->lr_priority)
01152                 return -ERANGE;
01153 
01154         if (r1_hops < r2_hops)
01155                 return 1;
01156 
01157         if (r1_hops > r2_hops)
01158                 return -ERANGE;
01159 
01160         if (p1->lp_txqnob < p2->lp_txqnob)
01161                 return 1;
01162 
01163         if (p1->lp_txqnob > p2->lp_txqnob)
01164                 return -ERANGE;
01165 
01166         if (p1->lp_txcredits > p2->lp_txcredits)
01167                 return 1;
01168 
01169         if (p1->lp_txcredits < p2->lp_txcredits)
01170                 return -ERANGE;
01171 
01172         if (r1->lr_seq - r2->lr_seq <= 0)
01173                 return 1;
01174 
01175         return -ERANGE;
01176 }
01177 
01178 static lnet_peer_t *
01179 lnet_find_route_locked(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t target, lnet_nid_t rtr_nid)
01180 {
01181         lnet_remotenet_t        *rnet;
01182         lnet_route_t            *route;
01183         lnet_route_t            *best_route;
01184         lnet_route_t            *last_route;
01185         struct lnet_peer        *lp_best;
01186         struct lnet_peer        *lp;
01187         int                     rc;
01188 
01189         /* If @rtr_nid is not LNET_NID_ANY, return the gateway with
01190          * rtr_nid nid, otherwise find the best gateway I can use */
01191 
01192         rnet = lnet_find_net_locked(LNET_NIDNET(target));
01193         if (rnet == NULL)
01194                 return NULL;
01195 
01196         lp_best = NULL;
01197         best_route = last_route = NULL;
01198         list_for_each_entry(route, &rnet->lrn_routes, lr_list) {
01199                 lp = route->lr_gateway;
01200 
01201                 if (!lnet_is_route_alive(route))
01202                         continue;
01203 
01204                 if (ni != NULL && lp->lp_ni != ni)
01205                         continue;
01206 
01207                 if (lp->lp_nid == rtr_nid) /* it's pre-determined router */
01208                         return lp;
01209 
01210                 if (lp_best == NULL) {
01211                         best_route = last_route = route;
01212                         lp_best = lp;
01213                         continue;
01214                 }
01215 
01216                 /* no protection on below fields, but it's harmless */
01217                 if (last_route->lr_seq - route->lr_seq < 0)
01218                         last_route = route;
01219 
01220                 rc = lnet_compare_routes(route, best_route);
01221                 if (rc < 0)
01222                         continue;
01223 
01224                 best_route = route;
01225                 lp_best = lp;
01226         }
01227 
01228         /* set sequence number on the best router to the latest sequence + 1
01229          * so we can round-robin all routers, it's race and inaccurate but
01230          * harmless and functional  */
01231         if (best_route != NULL)
01232                 best_route->lr_seq = last_route->lr_seq + 1;
01233         return lp_best;
01234 }
01235 
01236 int
01237 lnet_send(lnet_nid_t src_nid, lnet_msg_t *msg, lnet_nid_t rtr_nid)
01238 {
01239         lnet_nid_t              dst_nid = msg->msg_target.nid;
01240         struct lnet_ni          *src_ni;
01241         struct lnet_ni          *local_ni;
01242         struct lnet_peer        *lp;
01243         int                     cpt;
01244         int                     cpt2;
01245         int                     rc;
01246 
01247         /* NB: rtr_nid is set to LNET_NID_ANY for all current use-cases,
01248          * but we might want to use pre-determined router for ACK/REPLY
01249          * in the future */
01250         /* NB: ni != NULL == interface pre-determined (ACK/REPLY) */
01251         LASSERT (msg->msg_txpeer == NULL);
01252         LASSERT (!msg->msg_sending);
01253         LASSERT (!msg->msg_target_is_router);
01254         LASSERT (!msg->msg_receiving);
01255 
01256         msg->msg_sending = 1;
01257 
01258         LASSERT(!msg->msg_tx_committed);
01259         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(rtr_nid == LNET_NID_ANY ? dst_nid : rtr_nid);
01260  again:
01261         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
01262 
01263         if (the_lnet.ln_shutdown) {
01264                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01265                 return -ESHUTDOWN;
01266         }
01267 
01268         if (src_nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01269                 src_ni = NULL;
01270         } else {
01271                 src_ni = lnet_nid2ni_locked(src_nid, cpt);
01272                 if (src_ni == NULL) {
01273                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01274                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Can't send to %s: src %s is not a "
01275                                       "local nid\n", libcfs_nid2str(dst_nid),
01276                                       libcfs_nid2str(src_nid));
01277                         return -EINVAL;
01278                 }
01279                 LASSERT (!msg->msg_routing);
01280         }
01281 
01282         /* Is this for someone on a local network? */
01283         local_ni = lnet_net2ni_locked(LNET_NIDNET(dst_nid), cpt);
01284 
01285         if (local_ni != NULL) {
01286                 if (src_ni == NULL) {
01287                         src_ni = local_ni;
01288                         src_nid = src_ni->ni_nid;
01289                 } else if (src_ni == local_ni) {
01290                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(local_ni, cpt);
01291                 } else {
01292                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(local_ni, cpt);
01293                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01294                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01295                         LCONSOLE_WARN("No route to %s via from %s\n",
01296                                       libcfs_nid2str(dst_nid),
01297                                       libcfs_nid2str(src_nid));
01298                         return -EINVAL;
01299                 }
01300 
01301                 LASSERT(src_nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
01302                 lnet_msg_commit(msg, cpt);
01303 
01304                 if (!msg->msg_routing)
01305                         msg->msg_hdr.src_nid = cpu_to_le64(src_nid);
01306 
01307                 if (src_ni == the_lnet.ln_loni) {
01308                         /* No send credit hassles with LOLND */
01309                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01310                         lnet_ni_send(src_ni, msg);
01311 
01312                         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
01313                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01314                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01315                         return 0;
01316                 }
01317 
01318                 rc = lnet_nid2peer_locked(&lp, dst_nid, cpt);
01319                 /* lp has ref on src_ni; lose mine */
01320                 lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01321                 if (rc != 0) {
01322                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01323                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Error %d finding peer %s\n", rc,
01324                                       libcfs_nid2str(dst_nid));
01325                         /* ENOMEM or shutting down */
01326                         return rc;
01327                 }
01328                 LASSERT (lp->lp_ni == src_ni);
01329         } else {
01330                 /* sending to a remote network */
01331                 lp = lnet_find_route_locked(src_ni, dst_nid, rtr_nid);
01332                 if (lp == NULL) {
01333                         if (src_ni != NULL)
01334                                 lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01335                         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01336 
01337                         LCONSOLE_WARN("No route to %s via %s "
01338                                       "(all routers down)\n",
01339                                       libcfs_id2str(msg->msg_target),
01340                                       libcfs_nid2str(src_nid));
01341                         return -EHOSTUNREACH;
01342                 }
01343 
01344                 /* rtr_nid is LNET_NID_ANY or NID of pre-determined router,
01345                  * it's possible that rtr_nid isn't LNET_NID_ANY and lp isn't
01346                  * pre-determined router, this can happen if router table
01347                  * was changed when we release the lock */
01348                 if (rtr_nid != lp->lp_nid) {
01349                         cpt2 = lnet_cpt_of_nid_locked(lp->lp_nid);
01350                         if (cpt2 != cpt) {
01351                                 if (src_ni != NULL)
01352                                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01353                                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01354 
01355                                 rtr_nid = lp->lp_nid;
01356                                 cpt = cpt2;
01357                                 goto again;
01358                         }
01359                 }
01360 
01361                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Best route to %s via %s for %s %d\n",
01362                        libcfs_nid2str(dst_nid), libcfs_nid2str(lp->lp_nid),
01363                        lnet_msgtyp2str(msg->msg_type), msg->msg_len);
01364 
01365                 if (src_ni == NULL) {
01366                         src_ni = lp->lp_ni;
01367                         src_nid = src_ni->ni_nid;
01368                 } else {
01369                         LASSERT (src_ni == lp->lp_ni);
01370                         lnet_ni_decref_locked(src_ni, cpt);
01371                 }
01372 
01373                 lnet_peer_addref_locked(lp);
01374 
01375                 LASSERT(src_nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
01376                 lnet_msg_commit(msg, cpt);
01377 
01378                 if (!msg->msg_routing) {
01379                         /* I'm the source and now I know which NI to send on */
01380                         msg->msg_hdr.src_nid = cpu_to_le64(src_nid);
01381                 }
01382 
01383                 msg->msg_target_is_router = 1;
01384                 msg->msg_target.nid = lp->lp_nid;
01385                 msg->msg_target.pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE;
01386         }
01387 
01388         /* 'lp' is our best choice of peer */
01389 
01390         LASSERT (!msg->msg_peertxcredit);
01391         LASSERT (!msg->msg_txcredit);
01392         LASSERT (msg->msg_txpeer == NULL);
01393 
01394         msg->msg_txpeer = lp;                   /* msg takes my ref on lp */
01395 
01396         rc = lnet_post_send_locked(msg, 0);
01397         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01398 
01399         if (rc < 0)
01400                 return rc;
01401 
01402         if (rc == LNET_CREDIT_OK)
01403                 lnet_ni_send(src_ni, msg);
01404 
01405         return 0; /* rc == LNET_CREDIT_OK or LNET_CREDIT_WAIT */
01406 }
01407 
01408 void
01409 lnet_drop_message(lnet_ni_t *ni, int cpt, void *private, unsigned int nob)
01410 {
01411         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
01412         the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt]->drop_count++;
01413         the_lnet.ln_counters[cpt]->drop_length += nob;
01414         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01415 
01416         lnet_ni_recv(ni, private, NULL, 0, 0, 0, nob);
01417 }
01418 
01419 static void
01420 lnet_recv_put(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01421 {
01422         lnet_hdr_t      *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
01423 
01424         if (msg->msg_wanted != 0)
01425                 lnet_setpayloadbuffer(msg);
01426 
01427         lnet_build_msg_event(msg, LNET_EVENT_PUT);
01428 
01429         /* Must I ACK?  If so I'll grab the ack_wmd out of the header and put
01430          * it back into the ACK during lnet_finalize() */
01431         msg->msg_ack = (!lnet_is_wire_handle_none(&hdr->msg.put.ack_wmd) &&
01432                         (msg->msg_md->md_options & LNET_MD_ACK_DISABLE) == 0);
01433 
01434         lnet_ni_recv(ni, msg->msg_private, msg, msg->msg_rx_delayed,
01435                      msg->msg_offset, msg->msg_wanted, hdr->payload_length);
01436 }
01437 
01438 static int
01439 lnet_parse_put(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01440 {
01441         lnet_hdr_t              *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
01442         struct lnet_match_info  info;
01443         int                     rc;
01444         bool                    ready_delay;
01445 
01446         /* Convert put fields to host byte order */
01447         hdr->msg.put.match_bits = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.match_bits);
01448         hdr->msg.put.ptl_index  = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.ptl_index);
01449         hdr->msg.put.offset     = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.put.offset);
01450 
01451         info.mi_id.nid  = hdr->src_nid;
01452         info.mi_id.pid  = hdr->src_pid;
01453         info.mi_opc     = LNET_MD_OP_PUT;
01454         info.mi_portal  = hdr->msg.put.ptl_index;
01455         info.mi_rlength = hdr->payload_length;
01456         info.mi_roffset = hdr->msg.put.offset;
01457         info.mi_mbits   = hdr->msg.put.match_bits;
01458 
01459         msg->msg_rx_ready_delay = ni->ni_lnd->lnd_eager_recv == NULL;
01460         ready_delay = msg->msg_rx_ready_delay;
01461 
01462  again:
01463         rc = lnet_ptl_match_md(&info, msg);
01464         switch (rc) {
01465         default:
01466                 LBUG();
01467 
01468         case LNET_MATCHMD_OK:
01469                 lnet_recv_put(ni, msg);
01470                 return 0;
01471 
01472         case LNET_MATCHMD_NONE:
01473                 if (ready_delay)
01474                         /* no eager_recv or has already called it, should
01475                          * have been attached on delayed list */
01476                         return 0;
01477 
01478                 rc = lnet_ni_eager_recv(ni, msg);
01479                 if (rc == 0) {
01480                         ready_delay = true;
01481                         goto again;
01482                 }
01483                 /* fall through */
01484 
01485         case LNET_MATCHMD_DROP:
01486                 CNETERR("Dropping PUT from %s portal %d match "LPU64
01487                         " offset %d length %d: %d\n",
01488                         libcfs_id2str(info.mi_id), info.mi_portal,
01489                         info.mi_mbits, info.mi_roffset, info.mi_rlength, rc);
01490 
01491                 return -ENOENT; /* -ve: OK but no match */
01492         }
01493 }
01494 
01495 static int
01496 lnet_parse_get(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg, int rdma_get)
01497 {
01498         struct lnet_match_info  info;
01499         lnet_hdr_t              *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
01500         lnet_handle_wire_t      reply_wmd;
01501         int                     rc;
01502 
01503         /* Convert get fields to host byte order */
01504         hdr->msg.get.match_bits   = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.match_bits);
01505         hdr->msg.get.ptl_index    = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.ptl_index);
01506         hdr->msg.get.sink_length  = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.sink_length);
01507         hdr->msg.get.src_offset   = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.get.src_offset);
01508 
01509         info.mi_id.nid  = hdr->src_nid;
01510         info.mi_id.pid  = hdr->src_pid;
01511         info.mi_opc     = LNET_MD_OP_GET;
01512         info.mi_portal  = hdr->msg.get.ptl_index;
01513         info.mi_rlength = hdr->msg.get.sink_length;
01514         info.mi_roffset = hdr->msg.get.src_offset;
01515         info.mi_mbits   = hdr->msg.get.match_bits;
01516 
01517         rc = lnet_ptl_match_md(&info, msg);
01518         if (rc == LNET_MATCHMD_DROP) {
01519                 CNETERR("Dropping GET from %s portal %d match "LPU64
01520                         " offset %d length %d\n",
01521                         libcfs_id2str(info.mi_id), info.mi_portal,
01522                         info.mi_mbits, info.mi_roffset, info.mi_rlength);
01523                 return -ENOENT; /* -ve: OK but no match */
01524         }
01525 
01526         LASSERT(rc == LNET_MATCHMD_OK);
01527 
01528         lnet_build_msg_event(msg, LNET_EVENT_GET);
01529 
01530         reply_wmd = hdr->msg.get.return_wmd;
01531 
01532         lnet_prep_send(msg, LNET_MSG_REPLY, info.mi_id,
01533                        msg->msg_offset, msg->msg_wanted);
01534 
01535         msg->msg_hdr.msg.reply.dst_wmd = reply_wmd;
01536 
01537         if (rdma_get) {
01538                 /* The LND completes the REPLY from her recv procedure */
01539                 lnet_ni_recv(ni, msg->msg_private, msg, 0,
01540                              msg->msg_offset, msg->msg_len, msg->msg_len);
01541                 return 0;
01542         }
01543 
01544         lnet_ni_recv(ni, msg->msg_private, NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0);
01545         msg->msg_receiving = 0;
01546 
01547         rc = lnet_send(ni->ni_nid, msg, LNET_NID_ANY);
01548         if (rc < 0) {
01549                 /* didn't get as far as lnet_ni_send() */
01550                 CERROR("%s: Unable to send REPLY for GET from %s: %d\n",
01551                        libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid),
01552                        libcfs_id2str(info.mi_id), rc);
01553 
01554                 lnet_finalize(ni, msg, rc);
01555         }
01556 
01557         return 0;
01558 }
01559 
01560 static int
01561 lnet_parse_reply(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01562 {
01563         void             *private = msg->msg_private;
01564         lnet_hdr_t       *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
01565         lnet_process_id_t src = {0};
01566         lnet_libmd_t     *md;
01567         int               rlength;
01568         int               mlength;
01569         int                     cpt;
01570 
01571         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_cookie(hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01572         lnet_res_lock(cpt);
01573 
01574         src.nid = hdr->src_nid;
01575         src.pid = hdr->src_pid;
01576 
01577         /* NB handles only looked up by creator (no flips) */
01578         md = lnet_wire_handle2md(&hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd);
01579         if (md == NULL || md->md_threshold == 0 || md->md_me != NULL) {
01580                 CNETERR("%s: Dropping REPLY from %s for %s "
01581                         "MD "LPX64"."LPX64"\n",
01582                         libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), libcfs_id2str(src),
01583                         (md == NULL) ? "invalid" : "inactive",
01584                         hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01585                         hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01586                 if (md != NULL && md->md_me != NULL)
01587                         CERROR("REPLY MD also attached to portal %d\n",
01588                                md->md_me->me_portal);
01589 
01590                 lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
01591                 return -ENOENT; /* -ve: OK but no match */
01592         }
01593 
01594         LASSERT (md->md_offset == 0);
01595 
01596         rlength = hdr->payload_length;
01597         mlength = MIN(rlength, (int)md->md_length);
01598 
01599         if (mlength < rlength &&
01600             (md->md_options & LNET_MD_TRUNCATE) == 0) {
01601                 CNETERR("%s: Dropping REPLY from %s length %d "
01602                         "for MD "LPX64" would overflow (%d)\n",
01603                         libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), libcfs_id2str(src),
01604                         rlength, hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie,
01605                         mlength);
01606                 lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
01607                 return -ENOENT; /* -ve: OK but no match */
01608         }
01609 
01610         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: Reply from %s of length %d/%d into md "LPX64"\n",
01611                libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), libcfs_id2str(src),
01612                mlength, rlength, hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01613 
01614         lnet_msg_attach_md(msg, md, 0, mlength);
01615 
01616         if (mlength != 0)
01617                 lnet_setpayloadbuffer(msg);
01618 
01619         lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
01620 
01621         lnet_build_msg_event(msg, LNET_EVENT_REPLY);
01622 
01623         lnet_ni_recv(ni, private, msg, 0, 0, mlength, rlength);
01624         return 0;
01625 }
01626 
01627 static int
01628 lnet_parse_ack(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01629 {
01630         lnet_hdr_t       *hdr = &msg->msg_hdr;
01631         lnet_process_id_t src = {0};
01632         lnet_libmd_t     *md;
01633         int                     cpt;
01634 
01635         src.nid = hdr->src_nid;
01636         src.pid = hdr->src_pid;
01637 
01638         /* Convert ack fields to host byte order */
01639         hdr->msg.ack.match_bits = le64_to_cpu(hdr->msg.ack.match_bits);
01640         hdr->msg.ack.mlength = le32_to_cpu(hdr->msg.ack.mlength);
01641 
01642         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_cookie(hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01643         lnet_res_lock(cpt);
01644 
01645         /* NB handles only looked up by creator (no flips) */
01646         md = lnet_wire_handle2md(&hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd);
01647         if (md == NULL || md->md_threshold == 0 || md->md_me != NULL) {
01648                 /* Don't moan; this is expected */
01649                 CDEBUG(D_NET,
01650                        "%s: Dropping ACK from %s to %s MD "LPX64"."LPX64"\n",
01651                        libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), libcfs_id2str(src),
01652                        (md == NULL) ? "invalid" : "inactive",
01653                        hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01654                        hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01655                 if (md != NULL && md->md_me != NULL)
01656                         CERROR("Source MD also attached to portal %d\n",
01657                                md->md_me->me_portal);
01658 
01659                 lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
01660                 return -ENOENT;                  /* -ve! */
01661         }
01662 
01663         CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s: ACK from %s into md "LPX64"\n",
01664                libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid), libcfs_id2str(src),
01665                hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie);
01666 
01667         lnet_msg_attach_md(msg, md, 0, 0);
01668 
01669         lnet_res_unlock(cpt);
01670 
01671         lnet_build_msg_event(msg, LNET_EVENT_ACK);
01672 
01673         lnet_ni_recv(ni, msg->msg_private, msg, 0, 0, 0, msg->msg_len);
01674         return 0;
01675 }
01676 
01682 int
01683 lnet_parse_forward_locked(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01684 {
01685         int     rc = 0;
01686 
01687         if (!the_lnet.ln_routing)
01688                 return -ECANCELED;
01689 
01690         if (msg->msg_rxpeer->lp_rtrcredits <= 0 ||
01691             lnet_msg2bufpool(msg)->rbp_credits <= 0) {
01692                 if (ni->ni_lnd->lnd_eager_recv == NULL) {
01693                         msg->msg_rx_ready_delay = 1;
01694                 } else {
01695                         lnet_net_unlock(msg->msg_rx_cpt);
01696                         rc = lnet_ni_eager_recv(ni, msg);
01697                         lnet_net_lock(msg->msg_rx_cpt);
01698                 }
01699         }
01700 
01701         if (rc == 0)
01702                 rc = lnet_post_routed_recv_locked(msg, 0);
01703         return rc;
01704 }
01705 
01706 int
01707 lnet_parse_local(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_msg_t *msg)
01708 {
01709         int     rc;
01710 
01711         switch (msg->msg_type) {
01712         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
01713                 rc = lnet_parse_ack(ni, msg);
01714                 break;
01715         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
01716                 rc = lnet_parse_put(ni, msg);
01717                 break;
01718         case LNET_MSG_GET:
01719                 rc = lnet_parse_get(ni, msg, msg->msg_rdma_get);
01720                 break;
01721         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
01722                 rc = lnet_parse_reply(ni, msg);
01723                 break;
01724         default: /* prevent an unused label if !kernel */
01725                 LASSERT(0);
01726                 return -EPROTO;
01727         }
01728 
01729         LASSERT(rc == 0 || rc == -ENOENT);
01730         return rc;
01731 }
01732 
01733 char *
01734 lnet_msgtyp2str (int type)
01735 {
01736         switch (type) {
01737         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
01738                 return ("ACK");
01739         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
01740                 return ("PUT");
01741         case LNET_MSG_GET:
01742                 return ("GET");
01743         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
01744                 return ("REPLY");
01745         case LNET_MSG_HELLO:
01746                 return ("HELLO");
01747         default:
01748                 return ("<UNKNOWN>");
01749         }
01750 }
01751 
01752 void
01753 lnet_print_hdr(lnet_hdr_t * hdr)
01754 {
01755         lnet_process_id_t src = {0};
01756         lnet_process_id_t dst = {0};
01757         char *type_str = lnet_msgtyp2str (hdr->type);
01758 
01759         src.nid = hdr->src_nid;
01760         src.pid = hdr->src_pid;
01761 
01762         dst.nid = hdr->dest_nid;
01763         dst.pid = hdr->dest_pid;
01764 
01765         CWARN("P3 Header at %p of type %s\n", hdr, type_str);
01766         CWARN("    From %s\n", libcfs_id2str(src));
01767         CWARN("    To   %s\n", libcfs_id2str(dst));
01768 
01769         switch (hdr->type) {
01770         default:
01771                 break;
01772 
01773         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
01774                 CWARN("    Ptl index %d, ack md "LPX64"."LPX64", "
01775                       "match bits "LPU64"\n",
01776                       hdr->msg.put.ptl_index,
01777                       hdr->msg.put.ack_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01778                       hdr->msg.put.ack_wmd.wh_object_cookie,
01779                       hdr->msg.put.match_bits);
01780                 CWARN("    Length %d, offset %d, hdr data "LPX64"\n",
01781                       hdr->payload_length, hdr->msg.put.offset,
01782                       hdr->msg.put.hdr_data);
01783                 break;
01784 
01785         case LNET_MSG_GET:
01786                 CWARN("    Ptl index %d, return md "LPX64"."LPX64", "
01787                       "match bits "LPU64"\n", hdr->msg.get.ptl_index,
01788                       hdr->msg.get.return_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01789                       hdr->msg.get.return_wmd.wh_object_cookie,
01790                       hdr->msg.get.match_bits);
01791                 CWARN("    Length %d, src offset %d\n",
01792                       hdr->msg.get.sink_length,
01793                       hdr->msg.get.src_offset);
01794                 break;
01795 
01796         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
01797                 CWARN("    dst md "LPX64"."LPX64", "
01798                       "manipulated length %d\n",
01799                       hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01800                       hdr->msg.ack.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie,
01801                       hdr->msg.ack.mlength);
01802                 break;
01803 
01804         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
01805                 CWARN("    dst md "LPX64"."LPX64", "
01806                       "length %d\n",
01807                       hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_interface_cookie,
01808                       hdr->msg.reply.dst_wmd.wh_object_cookie,
01809                       hdr->payload_length);
01810         }
01811 
01812 }
01813 
01814 int
01815 lnet_parse(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_hdr_t *hdr, lnet_nid_t from_nid,
01816            void *private, int rdma_req)
01817 {
01818         int             rc = 0;
01819         int             cpt;
01820         int             for_me;
01821         struct lnet_msg *msg;
01822         lnet_pid_t     dest_pid;
01823         lnet_nid_t     dest_nid;
01824         lnet_nid_t     src_nid;
01825         __u32          payload_length;
01826         __u32          type;
01827 
01828         LASSERT (!in_interrupt ());
01829 
01830         type = le32_to_cpu(hdr->type);
01831         src_nid = le64_to_cpu(hdr->src_nid);
01832         dest_nid = le64_to_cpu(hdr->dest_nid);
01833         dest_pid = le32_to_cpu(hdr->dest_pid);
01834         payload_length = le32_to_cpu(hdr->payload_length);
01835 
01836         for_me = (ni->ni_nid == dest_nid);
01837         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(from_nid);
01838 
01839         switch (type) {
01840         case LNET_MSG_ACK:
01841         case LNET_MSG_GET:
01842                 if (payload_length > 0) {
01843                         CERROR("%s, src %s: bad %s payload %d (0 expected)\n",
01844                                libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01845                                libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01846                                lnet_msgtyp2str(type), payload_length);
01847                         return -EPROTO;
01848                 }
01849                 break;
01850 
01851         case LNET_MSG_PUT:
01852         case LNET_MSG_REPLY:
01853                 if (payload_length >
01854                     (__u32)(for_me ? LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD : LNET_MTU)) {
01855                         CERROR("%s, src %s: bad %s payload %d "
01856                                "(%d max expected)\n",
01857                                libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01858                                libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01859                                lnet_msgtyp2str(type),
01860                                payload_length,
01861                                for_me ? LNET_MAX_PAYLOAD : LNET_MTU);
01862                         return -EPROTO;
01863                 }
01864                 break;
01865 
01866         default:
01867                 CERROR("%s, src %s: Bad message type 0x%x\n",
01868                        libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01869                        libcfs_nid2str(src_nid), type);
01870                 return -EPROTO;
01871         }
01872 
01873         if (the_lnet.ln_routing &&
01874             ni->ni_last_alive != cfs_time_current_sec()) {
01875                 /* NB: so far here is the only place to set NI status to "up */
01876                 lnet_ni_lock(ni);
01877                 ni->ni_last_alive = cfs_time_current_sec();
01878                 if (ni->ni_status != NULL &&
01879                     ni->ni_status->ns_status == LNET_NI_STATUS_DOWN)
01880                         ni->ni_status->ns_status = LNET_NI_STATUS_UP;
01881                 lnet_ni_unlock(ni);
01882         }
01883 
01884         /* Regard a bad destination NID as a protocol error.  Senders should
01885          * know what they're doing; if they don't they're misconfigured, buggy
01886          * or malicious so we chop them off at the knees :) */
01887 
01888         if (!for_me) {
01889                 if (LNET_NIDNET(dest_nid) == LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid)) {
01890                         /* should have gone direct */
01891                         CERROR("%s, src %s: Bad dest nid %s "
01892                                "(should have been sent direct)\n",
01893                                 libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01894                                 libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01895                                 libcfs_nid2str(dest_nid));
01896                         return -EPROTO;
01897                 }
01898 
01899                 if (lnet_islocalnid(dest_nid)) {
01900                         /* dest is another local NI; sender should have used
01901                          * this node's NID on its own network */
01902                         CERROR("%s, src %s: Bad dest nid %s "
01903                                "(it's my nid but on a different network)\n",
01904                                 libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01905                                 libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01906                                 libcfs_nid2str(dest_nid));
01907                         return -EPROTO;
01908                 }
01909 
01910                 if (rdma_req && type == LNET_MSG_GET) {
01911                         CERROR("%s, src %s: Bad optimized GET for %s "
01912                                "(final destination must be me)\n",
01913                                 libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01914                                 libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01915                                 libcfs_nid2str(dest_nid));
01916                         return -EPROTO;
01917                 }
01918 
01919                 if (!the_lnet.ln_routing) {
01920                         CERROR("%s, src %s: Dropping message for %s "
01921                                "(routing not enabled)\n",
01922                                 libcfs_nid2str(from_nid),
01923                                 libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01924                                 libcfs_nid2str(dest_nid));
01925                         goto drop;
01926                 }
01927         }
01928 
01929         /* Message looks OK; we're not going to return an error, so we MUST
01930          * call back lnd_recv() come what may... */
01931 
01932         if (!list_empty(&the_lnet.ln_test_peers) &&     /* normally we don't */
01933             fail_peer(src_nid, 0)) {                    /* shall we now? */
01934                 CERROR("%s, src %s: Dropping %s to simulate failure\n",
01935                        libcfs_nid2str(from_nid), libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01936                        lnet_msgtyp2str(type));
01937                 goto drop;
01938         }
01939 
01940         if (!list_empty(&the_lnet.ln_drop_rules) &&
01941             lnet_drop_rule_match(hdr)) {
01942                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "%s, src %s, dst %s: Dropping %s to simulate"
01943                               "silent message loss\n",
01944                        libcfs_nid2str(from_nid), libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01945                        libcfs_nid2str(dest_nid), lnet_msgtyp2str(type));
01946                 goto drop;
01947         }
01948 
01949 
01950         msg = lnet_msg_alloc();
01951         if (msg == NULL) {
01952                 CERROR("%s, src %s: Dropping %s (out of memory)\n",
01953                        libcfs_nid2str(from_nid), libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01954                        lnet_msgtyp2str(type));
01955                 goto drop;
01956         }
01957 
01958         /* msg zeroed in lnet_msg_alloc; i.e. flags all clear,
01959          * pointers NULL etc */
01960 
01961         msg->msg_type = type;
01962         msg->msg_private = private;
01963         msg->msg_receiving = 1;
01964         msg->msg_rdma_get = rdma_req;
01965         msg->msg_len = msg->msg_wanted = payload_length;
01966         msg->msg_offset = 0;
01967         msg->msg_hdr = *hdr;
01968         /* for building message event */
01969         msg->msg_from = from_nid;
01970         if (!for_me) {
01971                 msg->msg_target.pid     = dest_pid;
01972                 msg->msg_target.nid     = dest_nid;
01973                 msg->msg_routing        = 1;
01974 
01975         } else {
01976                 /* convert common msg->hdr fields to host byteorder */
01977                 msg->msg_hdr.type       = type;
01978                 msg->msg_hdr.src_nid    = src_nid;
01979                 msg->msg_hdr.src_pid    = le32_to_cpu(msg->msg_hdr.src_pid);
01980                 msg->msg_hdr.dest_nid   = dest_nid;
01981                 msg->msg_hdr.dest_pid   = dest_pid;
01982                 msg->msg_hdr.payload_length = payload_length;
01983         }
01984 
01985         lnet_net_lock(cpt);
01986         rc = lnet_nid2peer_locked(&msg->msg_rxpeer, from_nid, cpt);
01987         if (rc != 0) {
01988                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
01989                 CERROR("%s, src %s: Dropping %s "
01990                        "(error %d looking up sender)\n",
01991                        libcfs_nid2str(from_nid), libcfs_nid2str(src_nid),
01992                        lnet_msgtyp2str(type), rc);
01993                 lnet_msg_free(msg);
01994                 goto drop;
01995         }
01996 
01997         if (lnet_isrouter(msg->msg_rxpeer)) {
01998                 lnet_peer_set_alive(msg->msg_rxpeer);
01999                 if (avoid_asym_router_failure &&
02000                     LNET_NIDNET(src_nid) != LNET_NIDNET(from_nid)) {
02001                         /* received a remote message from router, update
02002                          * remote NI status on this router.
02003                          * NB: multi-hop routed message will be ignored.
02004                          */
02005                         lnet_router_ni_update_locked(msg->msg_rxpeer,
02006                                                      LNET_NIDNET(src_nid));
02007                 }
02008         }
02009 
02010         lnet_msg_commit(msg, cpt);
02011 
02012         /* message delay simulation */
02013         if (unlikely(!list_empty(&the_lnet.ln_delay_rules) &&
02014                      lnet_delay_rule_match_locked(hdr, msg))) {
02015                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
02016                 return 0;
02017         }
02018 
02019         if (!for_me) {
02020                 rc = lnet_parse_forward_locked(ni, msg);
02021                 lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
02022 
02023                 if (rc < 0)
02024                         goto free_drop;
02025 
02026                 if (rc == LNET_CREDIT_OK) {
02027                         lnet_ni_recv(ni, msg->msg_private, msg, 0,
02028                                      0, payload_length, payload_length);
02029                 }
02030                 return 0;
02031         }
02032 
02033         lnet_net_unlock(cpt);
02034 
02035         rc = lnet_parse_local(ni, msg);
02036         if (rc != 0)
02037                 goto free_drop;
02038         return 0;
02039 
02040  free_drop:
02041         LASSERT(msg->msg_md == NULL);
02042         lnet_finalize(ni, msg, rc);
02043 
02044  drop:
02045         lnet_drop_message(ni, cpt, private, payload_length);
02046         return 0;
02047 }
02048 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_parse);
02049 
02050 void
02051 lnet_drop_delayed_msg_list(struct list_head *head, char *reason)
02052 {
02053         while (!list_empty(head)) {
02054                 lnet_process_id_t       id = {0};
02055                 lnet_msg_t              *msg;
02056 
02057                 msg = list_entry(head->next, lnet_msg_t, msg_list);
02058                 list_del(&msg->msg_list);
02059 
02060                 id.nid = msg->msg_hdr.src_nid;
02061                 id.pid = msg->msg_hdr.src_pid;
02062
